subject: Baseball
Philanthropy
lead_paragraph: The baseball players association filed a grievance against the major league clubs after the Los Angeles Dodgers said charitable donations would be required in future player contracts. “They’re making a lot of money, these players,” Frank McCourt, the Dodgers’ owner, said Thursday. The Major League Baseball Players Association filed the grievance Friday, saying the requirement violated baseball’s collective bargaining agreement. Unless the grievance is settled, the matter will be decided by the arbitrator Shyam Das. charity.
